div.p: Author of histories of literature, and philologist, who fought for the purification (Entwelschung) of the German language by excluding all foreign loan-words (especially those from Romance languages) and substituting German word-forms. In 1933, despite his German nationality, he was stripped of his pension, his books denounced and suppressed by the Nazi regime because he was a Jew.
He published some twenty-eight books between 1875 and 1928, including histories of French, English, and German literature (1882, 1883, 1906). Most influential were:
